Three former state probation officials indicted

A grand jury has indicted ex-Probation Commissioner John J. O'Brien and two former assistants, charging them with "racketeering conspiracy." (Globe, 10:10 a.m.)

State hampered by an unsavory witness

Most problematic for the prosecution was its star witness, whose checkered past helped the jury acquit one and fail to reach a verdict for the other defendant. (Boston Globe)

Dartmouth president is World Bank pick

President Obama nominated Dartmouth College President Jim Yong Kim to head the World Bank, senior administration officials said. (AP, 10:40 a.m.)

Bank of America to offer foreclosure plan

Bank of America said it has begun a program offering some of its mortgage customers facing foreclosure a chance to stay in their homes by becoming renters. (AP)
